definition: OPEC/Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
(used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: Some OPEC states are hankering for even higher oil prices in the months ahead.
sentences.chinese: 一些欧佩克成员国甚至希望未来几个月的油价更高。

sentences.english: It joined in 1962, just two years after the group was formed.
sentences.chinese: 它于1962年欧佩克成立两年之后加入了这个组织。

sentences.english: The four-fold increase in oil prices imposed by opec.
sentences.chinese: “欧佩克”石油价格的四倍上涨。

sentences.english: Essentially, the Saudis and OPEC profess to believe that the markets are currently well-supplied.
sentences.chinese: 沙特和欧佩克公开表示，目前石油市场供应充足。

sentences.english: Refineries lack the excess capacity to absorb the kind of oil Opec produces.
sentences.chinese: 一些炼油厂缺少过剩产能来吸收欧佩克增产的那些油。

pinyin: Shi2 you2 Shu1 chu1 guo2 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to lose output/a drop in crop yield/reduction in production
nations of the Persian Gulf/Gulf states

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Huo4 bi4 Ji1 jin1 Zu3 zhi1

definition: US Federal Reserve (Fed), the US central bank
